Event.name: Notification_of_charges
Event.definition:
<def-root>The judge or other court officer (the Authority) informs the <fen>Accused</fen> of the <fen>Charges</fen> against him/her, i.e. the alleged actions and the relevant laws. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Accused">The board</fex> has been <t>accused</t> <fex name="Arraign_authority">by the federal court</fex> <fex name="Charges">of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Arraign_authority">The police</fex> <t>charged</t> <fex name="Accused">a young nurse</fex> <fex name="Charges">with four murders</fex>.</ex> Compare to: Citing. </def-root>

Arg.name: Arraign_authority
Arg.definition: <def-root>The judge or other authority of the court in which the accused person is arraigned.</def-root>

Arg.name: Accused
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person being charged with an offense against the law.</def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root>The crime with which the Accused is charged</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The larger event which contains the Notification of Charges event. <ex>Seven people have been <t>indicted</t> <fex name="CE">in the seven-year investigation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: charge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: Charge a person with a crime

lexUnit.name: charge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal accusation made against a prisoner brought to trial

lexUnit.name: indict.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: formally accuse or charge with a serious crime.

lexUnit.name: indictment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal charge or accusation of a serious crime.

lexUnit.name: accuse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: charge with an offence or crime.
